text.div:
http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/extensions

Extensions defined by the build tools. These extensions are candidates for being elevated into the core.

Code Context Type Cardinality Notes
comment ValueSet.compose.include.code string 0..1 This is used in various FHIR value sets to make comments on how particular codes are used when the formal definition is a little abstract or vague, but it's not clear whether it belongs in the actual value set resource
display ValueSet.compose.include.code string 0..1 An alternative display is used to tailor a code's description to a particular use case. Doing this is dangerous, because it's easy to introduce a different meaning for the code in this context, but it's also useful to make the display suitable for a particular kind of user in a particular kind of context
definition ValueSet.compose.include.code string 0..1 This is provided for when the source code system doesn't actually provide a definition (there are many such). Providing an definition for a code should not be done where the underlying code system provides a definition
deprecated ValueSet.define.concept(.concept) boolean 0..1 Whether the concept has been deprecated
subsumes ValueSet.define.concept code 0..* Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
issue-source OperationOutcome string 0..1 Helps a user track down the source of the problem

concept.definition: The error comes from the publication example validator (only in the build process)
The error comes from the code that checks that profiles are valid
The error comes from the code the validates the basic resource definitions
The error comes from code that checks instances against the base profiles and any additional identified profiles

name: Extensions defined by the FHIR build tools
description: Extensions defined by the build tools. These extensions are candidates for being elevated into the core

definition.short: Comment about the use of this code in this context
definition.formal: A comment that explains how this code is used in this context (where the value set is expected to be used)
definition.comments: This is used in various FHIR value sets to make comments on how particular codes are used when the formal definition is a little abstract or vague, but it's not clear whether it belongs in the actual value set resource
definition.requirements: Too many codes have very abstract definitions, and the correct use or purpose of the code isn't sufficiently clear from the definition

definition.short: A different display for this code
definition.formal: A different display to use when this code is used as part of this value set
definition.comments: An alternative display is used to tailor a code's description to a particular use case. Doing this is dangerous, because it's easy to introduce a different meaning for the code in this context, but it's also useful to make the display suitable for a particular kind of user in a particular kind of context
definition.requirements: Many codes have displays that are inappropriate in a particular context of use

definition.formal: A display name that describes the meaning of this code when used as part of this value set
definition.comments: This is provided for when the source code system doesn't actually provide a definition (there are many such). Providing an definition for a code should not be done where the underlying code system provides a definition
definition.requirements: Some code systems don't provide definitions (most enumeration types)

definition.short: Whether the concept has been deprecated
definition.formal: Set to true of the concept has been deprecated (still can be used, but soon to be withdrawn)

definition.short: Codes that this concept subsumes that have already been declared elsewhere
definition.formal: Refers to another code defined within the code system that is also subsumed by this code. I.e. This concept subsumes the referenced concept.  Because meaning is inferred from hierarchy as well as definition, the presence of this extension modifies the meaning of the extended concept.
definition.requirements: For when the code system being defined is poly-heirarchical

definition.formal: Where in the code - schema, schematron, or validator - an error message comes from
definition.comments: Helps a user track down the source of the problem

definition.short: Hinting information for the narrative generator
definition.formal: Hinting information for the narrative generator - a series of name: value; pairs
definition.comments: known names: default (default value - don't represent if this value)
definition.requirements: Subtle ways to improve the generated narrative
